element.name: Mercury by Donnacha, Traditional Cache (2/3)

td.p: Located on the Little Sugar Loaf in Co. Wicklow. There are a couple ways of getting to it, but the quickest way is to start at N53 09.718 W6 07.252. You can park here also, but there is only enough room for about three cars. A speedy cacher could get up in just over 20 minutes from where you park. At the summit you will get a spectacular view of Greystones, Bray, and you can see the Tower on Dalky island perfectly. The cache is on the north-eastern side.

If you look south-west you'll see mammy Sugar Loaf. To the south is a Ring Fort in the middle of the Glen Of The Downs golf club, and if you look a little to the left you see a forest where the Speedway cache is located.

There are other caches in the area too, including Europe's first geocache, titled " Europe's First" which is on Bray Head, directly in front of the cache site. Back towards Greystones " All My Friends" is located on the Greystones to Bray Cliff Walk.

center.font: Visit the Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

element.encoded-hints: as you come down from the second peak, look for a mini christmas tree. cache is in some rocks to the right.

ul.li:
2010-05-30T19:00:00Z : Found it by GRIMB0
Long time since I climbed this mountain, but well worth it :-)

2010-05-27T19:00:00Z : Found it by EVILPETE
EVILPETE + MISSUS On holiday from England.A lot easier walk than Sweet hiking but still got good views. TN LN TFTC

2010-05-03T19:00:00Z : Found it by Determo
Beautiful sunny day, great views of the wicklow mountains and we could even see wales! Nice short walk! TFTC [8D]
- Determo, Aine, Niamh, Marie, Mary, Willie, & Zander - our guide dog puppy in training!

2010-04-20T19:00:00Z : Found it by kaputing
Quietly logged our 150th Cache, without an aeroplane jet trail in the sky, a sense of quiet in the air and some gentle dust on our shoulders. Actually the sun's rays were amazing through the clouds. Enjoyed the walk too. TFTC

2010-04-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by Spark_ie
First of todays finds. Fantastic day to be out, blue skies as far as you can see.. As far as the Volcanic Ash will allow you to see that is !! Co-ords spot on, great views, TFTC, Spark_ie

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Mercury
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Located on the Little Sugar Loaf in Co. Wicklow. There are a couple ways of getting to it, but the quickest way is to start at N53 09.718 W6 07.252. You can park here also, but there is only enough room for about three cars. A speedy cacher could get up in just over 20 minutes from where you park. At the summit you will get a spectacular view of Greystones, Bray, and you can see the Tower on Dalky island perfectly. The cache is on the north-eastern side.

If you look south-west you'll see mammy Sugar Loaf. To the south is a Ring Fort in the middle of the Glen Of The Downs golf club, and if you look a little to the left you see a forest where the Speedway cache is located.

There are other caches in the area too, including Europe's first geocache, titled " Europe's First" which is on Bray Head, directly in front of the cache site. Back towards Greystones " All My Friends" is located on the Greystones to Bray Cliff Walk.
